title: Table 709.1 – Drainage Fixture Units for Fixtures and Groups

content.heading: Table 709.1 – Drainage Fixture Units for Fixtures and Groups

table: | Fixture Type                                                                 | Drainage Fixture Unit Value | Minimum Size of Trap (inches) |
| Bathtubb (with or without overhead shower or whirlpool attachments)         | 2                            | 1 1/2                         |
| Kitchen sink, domestic w/ disposer and/or dishwasher                         | 2                            | 1 1/2                         |
| Urinal, 1 gallon per flush or less                                           | 2e                           | Note d                        |
| Wash sink (circular or multiple) per faucet set                              | 2                            | 1 1/2                         |
| Water closet, flushometer tank, public/private                               | 4e                           | Note d                        |
| Water closet, private (1.6 gpf)                                              | 3e                           | Note d                        |
| Water closet, private (>1.6 gpf)                                             | 4e                           | Note d                        |
| Water closet, public (1.6 gpf)                                               | 4e                           | Note d                        |
| Water closet, public (>1.6 gpf)                                              | 6e                           | Note d                        |

content.text: *For SI: 1 inch = 25.4 mm, 1 gallon = 3.785 L, gpf = gallon per flushing cycle, gpm = gallon per minute.*

content.bullet: a. For traps larger than 3 inches, use Table 709.2.
b. A showerhead over a bathtub or whirlpool bathtub attachment does not increase the drainage fixture unit value.
c. See Sections 709.2 through 709.4.1 for computing unit values of unlisted fixtures or intermittent flows.
d. Trap size shall match fixture outlet size.
e. Water closets and urinals cannot be rated at a lower DFU unless verified by testing.
f. Add additional fixtures' DFU to bathroom group total.
g. See Section 406.2 for washer drain sizing.
